mapper.sql: eb.id as id,eb.code as code,eb.user_id as user_id,eb.member_id as member_id,eb.status as status, eb.create_time as create_time,eb.update_time as update_time,eb.update_user as update_user, eb.quoted_time as quoted_time,eb.expire_date as expire_date
mapper.select: select enquiry_bills.id as id,code,enquiry_bills.user_id as user_id,member_id,status,enquiry_bills.create_time as create_time, enquiry_bills.update_time as update_time,update_user,quoted_time,expire_date, user_name AS userName,company_full_name as companyFullName,area_full as areaFull, user.contact_mobile as contactMobile, user.contact_name as contactName,user.type as userType, user.certify_status as certifyStatus, updateUser.name as updateUserName, member.name as quotedName, certification.type as companyType from enquiry_bills left join user on enquiry_bills.user_id = user.id left join member updateUser on update_user = updateUser.id left join member on member_id = member.id left join user_certification certification on enquiry_bills.user_id = certification.user_id WHERE enquiry_bills.id = #{id}
mapper.update:
update enquiry_bills
code = #{code},
user_id = #{userId},
member_id = #{memberId},
status = #{status},
create_time = #{createTime},
update_time = #{updateTime},
update_user = #{updateUser},
quoted_time = #{quotedTime},
expire_date = #{expireDate},
where id = #{id}
mapper.select:
select distinct b.id, b.code, b.user_id, b.member_id, b.status, b.create_time, b.expire_date from enquiry_bills b left outer join enquiry_commoditys c on b.id = c.bills_id
b.user_id=#{userId}
and b.status = #{status}
and b.expire_date >= DATE_FORMAT(#{expireDate},'%Y-%m-%d')
and b.expire_date < DATE_FORMAT(#{expireDate},'%Y-%m-%d')
and c.commodity_name like "%"#{commodityName}"%"
and DATE_FORMAT(b.create_time, '%Y-%m-%d') >= DATE_FORMAT(#{startDate},'%Y-%m-%d')
and DATE_FORMAT(b.create_time, '%Y-%m-%d') < DATE_FORMAT(DATE_ADD(#{endDate},INTERVAL 1 DAY),'%Y-%m-%d')
order by b.create_time DESC
select count(id) from enquiry_bills WHERE status=0
